episode_summary: This episode covers a range of quirky and fascinating topics, including a Swedish art project offering eternal employment, the ingenious adaptations of ninjas, the mishaps of urban climbers, and the peculiar rules and history of the Eurovision Song Contest.

facts.fact: Sweden's public art body has just commissioned an artwork, which will hire someone to do nothing at Gothenburg's course of art and train station for the next 120 years.
Ninjas' sword sheaths had removable tips so that if they ever had to hide underwater, they could use them like a snorkel to breathe.
One month before the French Spider Man successfully climbed the second tallest building in the world, he was hospitalised after falling from a seven foot tall traffic light.
In the early Eurovision Song Contests, songs could not be performed in public before the event. One Danish song was banned after the composer whistled it in a TV broadcaster's canteen.
